ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Focus on passive grammatical structures of all tenses, familiarization with Israeli culture and media, and a good amount of vocabulary, mostly very helpful function-words and we'd build up our content-word vocabulary almost as a side effect.
I developed an in depth look at Hebrew Grammar. Better writing skills. Fewer speaking skills than in other Hebrew classes I have taken at Yale.
Speaking, reading, writing in Hebrew language. Thorough understanding of grammar and vocabulary. Connections of modern Hebrew language to contemporary and historical culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Close and helpful student-teacher interactions, well designed and executed syllabus to optimize our learning. Good balance of reading, listening, speaking, and writing skill practices. The homework was very reasonable and seldom felt like busywork. Quizzes and exams were also well written and fairly graded. Would definitely recommend the course to someone looking to master their understanding of Hebrew.
Strengths Strong teaching Clear sense of content that is important to know Fair assessments Amazing TA Weaknesses Lots of content Not as much speaking Sometimes assignments feel unnecessary

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend the course, but only iif someone is interested in super intense language training.
Yes! You'll really learn how to speak/read/write Hebrew.
